content: 6 single_crochet 2 row 6 row 2 1 chain* increase 8 single_crochet increase 12 row 24 start on the second chain from row 3 1 chain* increase 10 single_crochet increase 14 the hook 3 single_crochet decrease 4 row 4 1 chain* increase 12 single_crochet increase 16 row 25 1 chain* 4 single_crochet 4 crochet the bobble stitches in light beige fasten_off and leave a extra long tail to sew to the body and tail row 5 1 chain* 1 single_crochet 2sc 1 bobble x 4 3 single_crochet 16 row 6 1 chain* 16 single_crochet 16 row 7 1 chain* 2sc 1 bobble x 5 1 single_crochet 16 row 8 1 chain* 16 single_crochet 16 row 9-16 repeat row 5-8 two more times row 17 start on the second chain from the hook 2 single_crochet 1 bobble x 4 1 single_crochet decrease 14 row 18 start on the second chain from the hook 11 single_crochet decrease 12 @handmade_by_halime assembly press the head against the body and sew it together from the round where the back loops are see picture sew two legs on each side of the body from round 10 approx 3-4 stitches between them sew the tail to the body from round 8 centered at the back sew the head shield on the head starting from where the mossgren color starts to the neck sew the body shield where the head shield ends on the neck to the tail the body shield will not be cover the whole tail you will still see a small part of the green tail take the yarn tail from the body shield and sew some strokes to cover this area see picture you can even tighten the threads so the ball points upwards sew the horns to the side of the head two on each side the top one will be placed on the edge of the head shield the second one will be placed 1 5-2 stitches below see it closer on next page @handmade_by_halime congrats the ankylosaurus tom anks your is done thank you for making him please share your gorgeous work don t forget to tag me @handmade_by_halime
